seo.title: Section 52A NDPS Act – Sampling & Bail Grounds
seo.description: Complete guide on Section 52A NDPS Act inventory and sampling procedure and its impact on bail.

articles.content:
What is Section 52A NDPS Act?

Section 52A of the NDPS Act mandates preparation of a detailed inventory of seized narcotic substances and sampling in the presence of a Magistrate.

Mandatory Protocol

Non-compliance with this procedure is fatal to the prosecution case and often leads to bail.

Key Requirements

  • Inventory after seizure
  • Magistrate supervision
  • Proper sealing
  • Chain of custody

Impact on Bail

Violation of Section 52A is a strong ground for bail.

articles.content:
Introduction

Maintenance under Section 125 CrPC protects wives from financial abandonment.

Who Can Claim Maintenance?

Legally married and divorced wives can claim maintenance.

Amount Calculation

  • Income of husband
  • Standard of living
  • Needs of wife and children

Supreme Court Guidelines

Rajnesh vs Neha (2020) laid down uniform maintenance rules.
